solution_line_template: For the first five books, the total cost is ${price_first_books}*{num_first_books} = $<<{price_first_books}*{num_first_books}={cost_first_books}>>{cost_first_books}
For every additional book over $5, you pay ${discount_amount} less, totaling to ${price_first_books}-${discount_amount} = ${discounted_price_per_book}

Beatrice bought {total_books_bought} books, so the number of books at which she received the ${discount_amount} discount is {total_books_bought}-{num_first_books} = <<{total_books_bought}-{num_first_books}={num_discounted_books}>>{num_discounted_books} books.
In total, Beatrice paid ${cost_first_books}+${cost_discounted_books} = $<<{cost_first_books}+{cost_discounted_books}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} for the {total_books_bought} books.
